intro: Galium neesianum, commonly known as the New Zealand bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers are typically surrounded by four to six small, leaf-like bracts. Galium neesianum is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth or along stream banks.
